abstract: After his firm threw off its government lifeline and roared back to profitability, Goldman Sachs’ chief executive, Lloyd C. Blankfein, has been awarded the top spot in Vanity Fair’s latest “New Establishment” power list.
snippet: After his firm threw off its government lifeline and roared back to profitability, Goldman Sachs’ chief executive, Lloyd C. Blankfein, has been awarded the top spot in Vanity Fair’s latest “New Establishment” power list.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs‘s chief executive may be telling his staff to keep a low profile, but his own name will soon appear prominently in the pages of a glossy magazine.

headline.main: Goldman Chief Tops Vanity Fair Power List
